item.title: Kathy add a quote by Ayn Rand
item.description: "Until and unless you discover that money is the root of all good, you ask for your own destruction. When money ceases to become the means by which men deal with one another, then men become the tools of other men. Blood, whips and guns--or dollars. Take your choice--there is no other." -- Ayn Rand

item.title: Kathy add a quote by Laura Ingalls Wilder
item.description: "Remember me with smiles and laughter, for that is how I will remember you all. If you can only remember me with tears, then don't remember me at all." -- Laura Ingalls Wilder

item.title: Kathy add a quote by Omar Khayyám
item.description: "The Moving Finger writes; and, having writ, Moves on: nor all thy Piety nor Wit Shall lure it back to cancel half a Line, Nor all thy Tears wash out a Word of it." -- Omar Khayyám

item.title: Kathy add a quote by Sir Thomas More
item.description: "For if you suffer your people to be ill-educated, and their manners to be corrupted from their infancy, and then punish them for those crimes to which their first education disposed them, what else is to be concluded from this, but that you first make thieves and then punish them." -- Sir Thomas More
